title: Picnic Near a Famous Landmark
caption: This photo combines travel and social connection. Focus: clear description, cautious inference, and TOEFL practice.

image.alt: A group of friends has a picnic in a park with a famous tower behind them.

fullDescription.en: This photo combines travel and social connection. The friends gather casually in a park, sharing food and conversation, while a recognizable city landmark frames the background. The relaxed posture and informal picnic items suggest a break from routine. The scene feels like a vacation day where sightseeing becomes more meaningful through shared experience and slow, unhurried time.

descriptions.advanced: This photo combines travel and social connection. The friends gather casually in a park, sharing food and conversation, while a recognizable city landmark frames the background. The relaxed posture and informal picnic items suggest a break from routine. The scene feels like a vacation day where sightseeing becomes more meaningful through shared experience and slow, unhurried time. In this setting (park near a famous landmark), focus on precise visual evidence before adding careful inference about intent or context. You can highlight actions such as having a picnic; talking and explain how they shape the interaction or outcome. Use specific nouns and modifiers for details like picnic food; drinks to improve clarity. Tone words (for example: relaxed; happy) help your response sound natural yet academic. You will practice academic vocabulary and structured responses for TOEFL speaking and writing tasks.

sceneNotes: Focus on what you can SEE (people, setting, actions).
- Simple: Mostly Present Continuous (am/is/are + V-ing) + basic 'There is/There are' for objects.
- Intermediate: Adds prepositional phrases (at/on/near), quantifiers (several/a few/a lot of), and 1 relative clause (who/that/where).
- Advanced: Adds inference language (probably/likely/might), contrast/linkers (while/whereas/in addition), and optional passive voice when relevant.
Add 1–2 inferences (why they are there, how they feel).
Use at least 2 collocations in your speaking/writing.

exercises.name: 6-minute paragraph (TOEFL style)
exercises.prompt: Write one paragraph (80–120 words) describing the photo: Friends relax on the grass for a picnic with a famous tower in the background.. Add one personal connection.

model.en: The photo shows mountain valley view: two hikers taking in the scenery with a calm, inspiring atmosphere. In the foreground, the people seem focused and relaxed as they take in the view. In the background, the landscape looks wide and dramatic, which makes the moment feel special. I have had a similar experience on a weekend trip, and it reminded me how refreshing nature can be. After this moment, they will probably keep exploring and take more photos.

grammarUsed.fa: حال استمراری برای کارهای در جریان، there is/are برای اشیای قابل مشاهده، و صفت/حروف اضافه برای توصیف محیط و حس.

en.tense: Present Continuous (am/is/are + V‑ing) for actions happening now in the photo.
howToBuild: Choose the subject (who?): they / the family / the coworkers.
Pick an action you can SEE and use am/is/are + V‑ing.
Add place details with prepositions: at, in, on, near.
Add one short feeling sentence: They look… / The atmosphere feels…
examples: The friends are having a picnic.
There are picnic food and drinks in park near a famous landmark.
The atmosphere feels relaxed.

fa.tense: حال استمراری (am/is/are + فعل ing) برای کارهایی که همین الآن در عکس در حال انجام است.
howToBuild: اول فاعل را انتخاب کن (چه کسی؟): they / the family / the coworkers.
یک کاری که در عکس می‌بینی انتخاب کن و با am/is/are + ing بساز.
جزئیات مکان را با حروف اضافه اضافه کن: at, in, on, near.
یک جمله کوتاه درباره حس اضافه کن: They look… / The atmosphere feels…
examples: آن‌ها در حال having a picnic هستند.
در park near a famous landmark picnic food و drinks دیده می‌شود.
فضا relaxed به نظر می‌رسد.

scenarios.title: A memory
scenarios.en: Last weekend, I found myself in park near a famous landmark. Friends relax on the grass for a picnic with a famous tower in the background. At first, I noticed picnic food, drinks, park grass and the way people were having a picnic. Then I looked closer: their clothing (casual travel clothing) and their expressions made the scene feel relaxed, happy, social. After that, something small happened that changed the mood, and we had to respond quickly. In the end, we solved it, and the moment became a story I still remember.
scenarios.fa: آخرِ هفته‌ی قبل park near a famous landmark بودم. Friends relax on the grass for a picnic with a famous tower in the background. اول picnic food، drinks و park grass را دیدم و اینکه آدم‌ها چطور having a picnic. بعد دقیق‌تر نگاه کردم: لباس‌ها (casual travel clothing) و حالت چهره‌ها باعث شد فضا relaxed، happy و social به نظر برسد. بعدش یک اتفاق کوچک افتاد که حال‌وهوا را عوض کرد و مجبور شدیم سریع واکنش نشان بدهیم. آخرش حلش کردیم و همان لحظه تبدیل شد به خاطره‌ای که هنوز یادم می‌ماند.

grammarUsed.en: Past simple with time marker (last weekend) and sequencing (at first/then/after that/in the end).
grammarUsed.fa: گذشته ساده با قید زمان و ترتیب رخدادها (اول/بعد/بعدش/آخرش).

en.tense: Past Simple (V2) to tell a short memory, plus sequencing words (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: Time markers: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago.
howToBuild: Start with a time phrase: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
Change the main action into past simple (reviewed, chose, played…).
Use sequencing words to make a clear story: first, then, after that, finally.
End with a result or feeling: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: Yesterday, the friends haved a picnic.
Then, the friends checked picnic food and continued.
Finally, they felt relaxed about the outcome.

fa.tense: گذشته ساده (Past Simple) برای تعریف یک خاطره کوتاه، همراه با کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: عبارات زمانی: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago
howToBuild: با یک عبارت زمانی شروع کن: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
فعل اصلی را به گذشته ساده تبدیل کن (reviewed, chose, played…).
از کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده استفاده کن: first, then, after that, finally.
با نتیجه یا حس تمام کن: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: دیروز، The friends haved a picnic.
بعد، The friends picnic food را بررسی کرد و ادامه داد.
در نهایت، آن‌ها درباره نتیجه relaxed بودند.

scenarios.title: Reflection
scenarios.en: Over the past few months, I have started paying attention to scenes like this. I have noticed that details such as picnic food, drinks, park grass, landmark tower (background) are not background; they guide the story. I have also learned how actions like talking can signal feelings such as relaxed, happy, social. Since then, I have taken more time to observe before I speak, and my descriptions have become clearer and more specific.
scenarios.fa: در چند ماه گذشته شروع کرده‌ام به صحنه‌هایی مثل این بیشتر دقت کنم. متوجه شده‌ام جزئیاتی مثل picnic food، drinks، park grass و landmark tower (background) فقط «پس‌زمینه» نیستند؛ آن‌ها مسیر داستان را تعیین می‌کنند. همچنین یاد گرفته‌ام کارهایی مثل talking چطور می‌تواند احساساتی مثل relaxed، happy و social را نشان بدهد. از آن زمان بیشتر قبل از حرف زدن مشاهده می‌کنم و توصیف‌هایم واضح‌تر و دقیق‌تر شده است.

grammarUsed.en: Present perfect to connect past learning to the present, plus since/over the past to frame experience.
grammarUsed.fa: حال کامل برای وصل کردن یادگیری گذشته به حال، همراه با «در چند ماه گذشته/از آن زمان».

en.tense: Present Perfect (have/has + past participle) to connect past experience to the present; use since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: Say what has happened up to now (experience/result).
Use since (a starting point) or for (a duration).
Add a contrast or reflection: however, although, even though.
Finish with what they are doing now (present continuous) if needed.
examples: The friends have already handled similar situations before.
The friends have learned to stay relaxed in park near a famous landmark.
Although it looks routine, the details have mattered.

fa.tense: حال کامل (have/has + شکل سوم فعل) برای ربط دادن گذشته به حال؛ همراه با since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: بگو تا همین الآن چه تجربه/نتیجه‌ای اتفاق افتاده.
از since (نقطه شروع) یا for (مدت زمان) استفاده کن.
یک جمله‌ی بازتاب/تضاد اضافه کن: however, although, even though.
اگر لازم شد با یک جمله حال استمراری وضعیت الآن را بگو.
examples: The friends قبلاً موقعیت‌های مشابهی را تجربه کرده است.
The friends یاد گرفته است در park near a famous landmark relaxed بماند.
اگرچه کار روتین به نظر می‌رسد، جزئیات مهم بوده‌اند.

scenarios.title: A challenge
scenarios.en: If we were to replay this moment in park near a famous landmark, one small change could create a big problem. If picnic food, drinks had been missing or damaged, we would have had to improvise. Someone might have said, “We should slow down and check,” and another person could have replied that we were running out of time. In a situation like this, we should prioritize safety and clarity, even if it means changing the plan. If I had ignored those details, I might have misunderstood the whole scene.
scenarios.fa: اگر قرار بود این لحظه در park near a famous landmark دوباره تکرار شود، یک تغییر کوچک می‌توانست یک مشکل بزرگ بسازد. اگر picnic food و drinks نبود یا آسیب دیده بود، مجبور می‌شدیم بداهه تصمیم بگیریم. ممکن بود کسی بگوید «باید آهسته‌تر برویم و بررسی کنیم» و نفر دیگری جواب بدهد که وقت کم داریم. در چنین موقعیتی بهتر است ایمنی و شفافیت را در اولویت بگذاریم، حتی اگر مجبور شویم برنامه را تغییر بدهیم. اگر آن جزئیات را نادیده می‌گرفتم، شاید کل صحنه را اشتباه می‌فهمیدم.

grammarUsed.en: Conditionals for hypotheticals, modals for advice/possibility, and short reported speech (might have said/could have replied).
grammarUsed.fa: شرطی‌ها برای موقعیت فرضی، افعال کمکی برای امکان/پیشنهاد، و نقل‌قول غیرمستقیم برای بازگویی گفت‌وگو.

en.tense: Mixed grammar for higher-level storytelling: conditionals, modals (might/must), and reported speech.
sentenceStructure: Second conditional: If + past simple, would + base verb.
Third conditional: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
Modals of deduction: might/must/can't + base verb.
Reported speech: He said (that) … / She asked if …
howToBuild: Describe the challenge and add a hypothetical solution (If…, would…).
Use modals to infer causes from the photo (They might…, It must…).
Add reported speech for realism: Someone said that…
Finish with a consequence or lesson learned.
examples: If the friends had checked picnic food earlier, they would have avoided a mistake.
They might be under pressure, but they must stay relaxed.
The supervisor said that every detail mattered.

fa.tense: گرامر ترکیبی سطح بالا: شرطی‌ها، افعال کمکی (might/must) و نقل قول غیرمستقیم (reported speech).
sentenceStructure: شرطی نوع دوم: If + past simple, would + فعل ساده.
شرطی نوع سوم: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
نقل قول غیرمستقیم: He said (that)… / She asked if…
howToBuild: چالش را بگو و یک راه‌حل فرضی اضافه کن (If…, would…).
با مدال‌ها درباره علت‌ها حدس بزن (might/must).
برای واقعی‌تر شدن از reported speech استفاده کن.
در پایان نتیجه یا درسِ داستان را بگو.
examples: اگر The friends زودتر picnic food را چک کرده بود، اشتباه را جلوگیری می‌کرد.
ممکن است تحت فشار باشند، اما باید relaxed بمانند.
سرپرست گفت که هر جزئیاتی مهم است.
